recipe.name: Vegetarian Chow Mein
recipe.description: This vegetarian/vegan version of chow mein is very close to the traditional version, but I have created a sauce without oyster sauce in it - and obviously substituted the meat with tofu. This recipe contains directions to make this from scratch as well as the directions for making this using my Real Chinese All Purpose Stir Fry Sauce (Vegetarian version) which, if you have a stash of it on hand, makes this super quick to make because you already have the sauce ready made!
recipeIngredient: 6 oz / 180 g   fresh chow mein noodles
1/2 tbsp chilli garlic sauce or sriracha ((optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare noodles according to packet instructions (usually soaking it in boiling water).
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare noodles according to packet instructions (usually soaking it in boiling water).

recipeInstructions.text: Combine tofu with marinade and set aside for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine tofu with marinade and set aside for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine sauce ingredients in a small bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in wok over high heat, add garlic and stir fry for 10 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in wok over high heat, add garlic and stir fry for 10 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add tofu and stir fry until starting to caramelise - about 1 minute. Stir fry gently so the tofu doesn't break.
recipeInstructions.name: Add tofu and stir fry until starting to caramelise - about 1 minute. Stir fry gently so the tofu doesn't break.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cabbage and carrot and stir fry until the cabbage starts to wilt.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cabbage and carrot and stir fry until the cabbage starts to wilt.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the noodles, scallions/shallots, bean sprouts and sauce and stir fry until the noodles are warmed through and sauce evenly coats the noodles - about 1 minute. Don't cook it too much - the bean sprouts should still be quite crisp, not wilted.
